name: TheAtlantic
text: "A new story doesn’t mean that we discard all the elements of the old story, nor does it mean that we dwell only on our sins. Instead, we narrate our national beginnings in light of our contradictions and our aspirations," @esglaude writes: https://t.co/wO3pS7JcNc

name: TheAtlantic
text: NASA is typically associated with feats of space exploration, writes @PhilipHilts, but the agency has also played a key role in shaping the study of life on Earth. https://t.co/Asky9f8cHe

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @SwatiGauri: John Lewis in 2014: “In the presence of injustice, no one has the right to be silent.” A legend. https://t.co/huP9f8XvlP

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @Saahil_Desai: "As politics have become ever more tribal and polarizing, Lewis’s image has softened and grown more broadly appealing to politicians seeking even just one example of a moral leader who can transcend the ideological divide." https://t.co/zZtrtdDFgi

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YasmeenSerhan: Britain’s efforts to house thousands of people amid the pandemic proves that even the most intractable problems are solvable—with enough political will.

My latest: 
https://t.co/gPddpX8INk

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: There’s no one who can fill the void in American politics left by John Lewis’s death. Read ⁦@russellberman⁩ from December:  https://t.co/4z6ToPQTQC

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @russellberman: The nation is mourning the death of John Lewis, a civil rights icon. When he announced his cancer diagnosis in December, I wrote about how he had become, perhaps, the last unifying force in a polarized Congress: https://t.co/H1rlMo1rVJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @PeterAtlantic: A first-in-the-nation law in Colorado aimed at police accountability has activists celebrating and officers worrying, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/OTll84C1cy

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Evidently, in almost all of the justices’ view, it is far more appropriate, and raises far fewer concerns, for a state grand jury to investigate the president than for the United States Congress to do so," Robert Black writes: https://t.co/ORScJ8bvaV

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: John Lewis: Photos From a Life Spent Getting Into Good Trouble - 28 images of the life and work of the civil rights icon and long-serving U.S. Congressman, who passed away yesterday, at the age of 80. https://t.co/Eyi230t1N1 https://t.co/xBAgiLY7mB

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: Here’s John Lewis writing for The Atlantic in 2014: “There is a growing discontent in this country. And if the fires of frustration and discontent continue to grow without redress, I fear for the future of this country. There will not be peace in America.” https://t.co/VEszlKi6Hd
